text:
This restaurant do THE BEST POUTINE on Montreal!
Enjoy it!

Cela fait plusieurs années que je vis dans ce quartier, et ce midi, moi et un ami, on voulait voir la cuisine fait la bas.  On savait que c'était une cuisine simple et un peu graisseuse en partant et c'est ce qu'on voulait. J'ai prit le sousmarin olympique, et c'était très bon, accompagner de ses frites maisons. Mon amis a prit un sandwich Western accompagner d'une salade César. Le sandwich était bon, la vinaigrette de la salade était un peu trop vinaigré a son goût. Le service était cependant lent, pour la prise de la commande et pour la facture, il a fallut se lever et aller au comptoir pour l'avoir, après une bonne attente. Il n'y avait pourtant pas beaucoup de client et deux serveuses en place. Le repas lui est arrivé très rapidement sur la table. 
Le menu déjeuner semble bon, on va y retourner prochainement pour l'essayer. 
Donc a part un manque dans le service, tout était bien.

I've been in the neighborhood for two years now and it's the first time that I came here, and let me tell you, I love this place.

I came here looking for a simple breakfast after a night out and here it was! 5$ for a plate of eggs, bacon, potatoes and toasts. I enjoyed it while watching the news on TV and the waitress was friendly, talking to me every now and then. There were also some regulars talking with the staff and it was a warm, familiar atmosphere. It really felt like a diner with the red seats and booths and the kind of retro decoration.

This place is more of a one time thing...!! The subs are delicious but the combos are expensive. 

They give you a tiny portion of fries that are not bad but not the best, with a little plastic cup of pepsi...!! 

For a 6inch combo its almost 10$ with taxes and for 10inch its around 15$, all this served on carton plates...!! If I'm gonna pay a little more than any regular Sub places(including Subway) I at least expect a regular can of pepsi in my combo with regular plates. Like I said, its a one time experience for the Subs but thats it!
The poutine was very mediocre, but the steamed hot dogs were amazing, especially the coleslaw that goes on top of them.
Belle place, un vrai feeling d'etre dans un ptit resto en campagne, fait du bien de voir que ca existe encore en ville. Bonne bouff pour sque j'ai essayé!

Meilleure pizza dans le coin à date. Cependant, je suis obligée de mettre 4 étoiles pour les raisons suivantes:

Service un peu lent (50 minutes) Ceci dit, ca semble être la norme dans le coin (45 minutes)
Assez cher, 23.50$ pour un  Extravaganza Vincent Pizza avec sauce aux tomates, pepperoni, bacon, oignons, piments verts, champignons, olives vertes et mozzarella, 12 pouces
Pizza est plutôt tiède en arrivant

Mercier-Hochelaga-Maisonneuve is the best borough on this big beautiful island and Vincent Sous-marin has -- ass down, face up; that's the way we like to fuck -- the single most bestest awesomenessest POUTINE ever. This is the poutine of the good hood. Come here for quality, quantity and authenticity. The patate frites are fried in premium decades-aged Hochelaga frying oil, topped with the freshest and squeakiest cheddar cheese curds with a beautiful sauce brun. Eat and be merry.

If you are planning to order a sub and poutine, save your money and order from some place else. 
Over priced for no reason and ive tasted better. 

I ordered the steak and pepperoni sub. It tasted alright but it was dry and tasted bland.  It didn't come with sauce so you would have to ask for it. 

The poutine was not worth it to order.  The fries were less than average tasting. The potato tasted under cooked. It was hard to ignore - even though the cheese and gravy tasted alright. 

If you take out ,, ask for utencils and napkins cuz they don't ask if u need and it doesn't come with. 

Paid 30$ for everything with tip and not impressed for a "4 star rating". 

Unfortunately, will not be ordering here again.
The subs are amazing! As well as the fettuccine! The hot hamburger was a bit of a disappointment considering the fact that everything else was great!

I finally managed to make my way here and immediately ordered their steak submarine and small classic poutine. I've had a bookmark here for the longest time!

The ordering process is kind of neat with this establishment employing waitresses in a casse-croûte style of joint. The service was very kind and helpful. We had a few young children with us and they accommodated us nicely. 

After 10 minutes our meals were served and I literally destroyed my steak sandwich as I was famished. The submarine was very good with high quality fresh ingredients. My only qualm was the bread being too small to hold it all together. I hate needing to cut my subs into smaller segments or have it risk being ruined with needless spillage while it is being transitioned from the plate, to my hands until its final destination... my stomach. The quality of the bread must be better and my favorite subs are those with bread made with potato dough for extra flavor. Either way, it was pretty good. Typical as it gets.

The poutine itself was between good and very good. A staple of classic casse-croûte style poutine found in many local institutions across the province.

The price tag is average for this type of cuisine.

Overall, I enjoyed it and would find myself come back one day.

Dans le cadre de mes recherches insatiables pour dénicher les plus authentiques restos de quartier, je suis tombé sur Vincent Sousmarins. On m'avait déjà dit de ce resto qu'il s'agissait d'une véritable institution dans l'Est de Montréal. À voir les assistes livrées par les serveuses aux tables autour de moi, j'ai vite compris pourquoi. Chaque assiette est accompagnée d'une montagne de frittes dorées. Et les portions sont généreuses, très généreuse.
 
Comme son nom l'indique, l'endroit se spécialise dans la préparation des Sousmarins. En tout, plus d'une douzaine au menu. On vous offre aussi un menu très varié de pâtes sans oublier les poutines. Les pizzas sont aussi excellentes. Ne manquez pas de gouter aux frittes maisons. À elles seules, elles valent le détour. Pour ma part, je vous suggère le Sousmarin Olympique qui tire son nom des XXIe olympiades de Montréal (Oui, le resto est ouvert depuis le début des années 70).  
 
Vincent Sousmarin est un « greasy spoon » classique. Bonne bouffe graisseuse, portions généreuses, décors « cheap », serveuses aimables et clientèle bigarrée. Il ne faut pas y aller chaque jour, mais une fois de temps en temps, ça fait du bien au moral.
